sentence:
…ANSWERED ``PRESENT''--1               Paul                                       NOT VOTING--4       Blackburn      Gallego      Ossoff      Padilla

The motion was rejected.

(Mr. Moreno assumed the Chair.)

…Even the nonpartisan  Congressional Budget Office has said there is no way to meet the  Republican budget resolution dedicated cuts without cutting Medicaid or  Medicare.

(Mr. MORENO assumed the Chair.)

Tonight and into tomorrow morning, I am going to do everything I can  to elevate the voices of Republicans because this is not intended to be  a partisan…
The PRESIDING OFFICER (Mr. Moreno). The majority leader.
The PRESIDING OFFICER (Mr. Moreno). The Senator from Idaho.
The PRESIDING OFFICER (Mr. Moreno). The Senator from Oregon.                      Motion to Table Amendment No. 3946
The PRESIDING OFFICER (Mr. Moreno). The Senator from Rhode Island.
Mr. MORENO.  Res. 160, which is at the desk.
The PRESIDING OFFICER (Mr. Moreno). The Senator from Vermont.
Mr. MORENO.  241; that the nomination be confirmed; that the motion to  reconsider be considered made and laid upon the table with no  intervening action or debate; that no further…
Mr. MORENO.  Res. 400, which was submitted  earlier today.

The PRESIDING OFFICER (Mr. Moreno). On this vote, the yeas are 50,  the nays are 45. The motion is agreed to.

The motion was agreed to.
Mr. MORENO.  Res. 272, which is at the desk.
The PRESIDING OFFICER (Mr. Moreno). Without objection, it is so  ordered.
The PRESIDING OFFICER (Mr. Moreno). The Senator from Virginia.
The PRESIDING OFFICER (Mr. Moreno). The Senator from Missouri.                                   Tariffs
Mr. MORENO. Mr. President, I understand that there is a bill at the  desk, and I ask for its first reading.
The PRESIDING OFFICER (Mr. Moreno). The Senator from California.
